Despite the exaggerated news of the untimely 'death of the detail' by Greg Lynn, the architectural detail is now more lifelike and active than ever before. In this era of digital design and production technologies, new materials, parametrics, building information modeling (BIM), augmented realities and the nanoÃ¢â‚¬â€œbioÃ¢â‚¬â€œinformationÃ¢â‚¬â€œcomputation consilience, the detail is now an increasingly vital force in architecture.
